HORIZON.Definition: the line at which the earth's surface and the sky meet

COACHMAN.Definition: the driver of the horse-drawn carriage or vehicle

NECESSITY.Definition: the state of being required, need

ROBBER.Definition: the one who was stealing from them

HIGHWAYMAN.Definition: an outlaw who stole from people on the road

ASSUME.Definition: accept it without question or proof

SERIALISED.Definition: published in regular parts or episodes

ILLITERATE.Definition: not able to read or write

DISPARAGINGLY.Definition: in a critical or unkind way

FORMULAIC.Definition: being of no special quality or type

TIRELESSLY.Definition: without getting tired, in an energetic way

LITERACY.Definition: the ability to read and write

CHIMNEY SWEEPS.Definition: people whose job was to clean the inside of chimneys (the pipes that lead the smoke of a fireplace out)

ALL MANNER OF.Definition: a lot of different types of

BOOT POLISH.Definition: a substance used to protect boots and make them shine

SUPERNATURAL.Definition: forces that cannot be explained by science or the laws of nature

BREAK THE BANK.Definition: cost more than they could afford

RAZOR.Definition: a device with a sharp blade for removing hair

HIGHWAYMEN.Definition: outlaws who stole from people on the road

STORYLINES.Definition: types of stories or the main events of the stories

SLUMS.Definition: the poor areas of the city

VAMPIRES.Definition: dead people who come back to life and drink the blood of the living

CRAZE.Definition: great interest and enthusiasm about something

MORALISTIC.Definition: judging people about what they think is right or wrong

INFERIORS.Definition: people who weren't as good as them

OVERSTATE.Definition: describe it as something more serious than it really was

PANIC.Definition: sudden and strong feeling of fear

BLAMED.Definition: considered to have happened because of them

VERDICT.Definition: official decision about what had happened

INSANITY.Definition: the condition of being mad or crazy

STAB.Definition: hit her with a sharp object

SUICIDES.Definition: the acts of people killing themselves

PATRIOTICALLY.Definition: in a way that showed love for the country

ACCESSIBILITY.Definition: the fact of being easily liked and obtained

THE TURN OF THE CENTURY.Definition: the time when the previous century ended and the next began

MORALITY.Definition: standards of good or bad behaviour

ENCOURAGE.Definition: make them more likely to do it

OVERSTATEMENT.Definition: the action of describing it as more important than it really was

SINGLE-HANDEDLY.Definition: without help from anything else, alone

FABRIC OF SOCIETY.Definition: the order or culture of society

EQUIVALENTS.Definition: things that have the same meaning
